channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Intruder coming out of allotments at 4:15 am, 24th October
item.description:
This is the 2nd time this week someone leaving the allotments during insociable hours. 4:16am is recorded. Clearly not a normal activity and no evidence of entry. Idea has been sent to pencil and police.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Farm Avenue, Longlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Footpath overgrown, 24th October
item.description:
A stretch of approx 100m of footpath is almost completely overgrown. The sign shows that this should be a split use footpath/cycle path. Walking in the cycle path is dangerous, with e-bikes and scooters passing at ridiculous speed and I myself have had several near misses. The footpath should be cut back to the barrier indicated in the photo

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Watermead Way, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bin lorry sounds like herd of elephants trumpeting, 24th October
item.description:
Can the council please do some maintenance on the bin lorries, there's a few that really need greasing up or lubricating they sound like a herd of elephants trumpeting when the bins are raised and lowered at the back it can be heard from multiple streets away.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 199, Brook Street, Northumberland Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gravel Hill, Bexley, London

item.title: Filth left behind after recent gas works, 24th October
item.description:
Our road has been closed for weeks due to the continued gas works in the borough. However the mess/mud left behind in the road and on the pavement is disgraceful. People will be walking this into their homes. The pavement and road where the soil was stored needs a proper jet wash
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chestnut Drive, Welling, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Reopen case FixMyStreet ref: 7980010 not fixed! - Noise pollution, 24th October
item.description:
Noise pollution This had been happening for 3 plus years and is worsening, The road surface has been damaged by the weight of Environ electric busses. When the busses travel over the surface they create a lot of noise and vibration which shakes my entire house. This wakes me up at all hours of the night and early morning. The panels on the busses vibrate as they travel over the indentations in the road, causing additional noise pollution. This situation is unacceptable as I cannot sleep. Also, the vibrations have caused my driveway and front of house to crack.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hook Lane, Blackfen, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Mattress left on pavement opposite Canal Walk plus other rubbish left near entrance to Canal Walk., 24th October
item.description:
These are regular fly tipping spots. Signs and cameras need to be installed. Sadly, so many people do not care about their environment or that of others. Two locations at the Lee Road end of Meadowcourt Road, near Canal Walk. Thank you!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Meadowcourt Road, Horn Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Carriageway being used for a 'cars and vans' advertisement device Shortlands Rd, Shortlands approximately on the opposite side of the road from 20, Shortlands Rd., 24th October
item.description:
Carriageway being used for a 'cars and vans' advertisement device Shortlands Rd, Shortlands approximately on the opposite side of the road from 20, Shortlands Rd. An ad is stuck on the rear window making the car illegal by virtue of obstructing the rear view, too. EA13 XMJ Turquoise Vauxhall Corsa?

item.title: Footway fronting Deli Nene 52-54 High Street, Beckenham BR3 1AY. Excessive restaurant gubbins narrowing this busy PUBLIC footway to less than 2m wide, 24th October
item.description:
Footway fronting Deli Nene 52-54 High Street, Beckenham BR3 1AY. Excessive restaurant gubbins narrowing this busy PUBLIC footway to less than 2m wide. People have to wait for each other to pass before they can proceed, or walk in the busy road. Photo Saturday 18/10/25 after waiting for people to clear the location to avoid them being in the photo.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 50, High Street, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Beckenham Shield has been removed from the street name late in High St, Beckenham near the planter on the corner with Albemarle Rd, 24th October
item.description:
Beckenham Shield has been removed from the street name late in High St, Beckenham near the planter on the corner with Albemarle Rd. Intact SNP as the 2nd photo for comparison. These were part of the £4.4m 'Beckenham Improvements' Scheme c. 2018. It is a pity the shield was just a stick on, rather than painted on feature, and so is vulnerable to removal.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 16-18, High Street, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
